cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (Potential Tropical Cyclone status – 35 mph)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles S of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to track NW across the north-western Caribbean, cross the Cayman Islands Monday night, western Cuba Tuesday, then turn NNW–N into the central Gulf with a final bend toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Port Fourchon–Atchafalaya Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time – watches confined to western Cuba and Cayman Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for U.S. – warnings confined to Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi/Alabama line, including all of coastal Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Increasing to tropical-storm force (39–57 mph) Friday with a 30 % chance of sustained ≥34 kt and gusts higher; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if Delta strengthens more than forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for at least minor surge >3 ft along the lower Mississippi River delta and adjacent bays owing to onshore flow at landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands capable of 4-8 inches of rain Friday–Saturday, producing flash-flood risk along the river system and port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; rapid rises on tidal rivers; possible channel silting and debris that could disrupt navigation.
